column4: hey, I am trying to mount a samba share which is hosted on my ubuntu server from my mac...
and this same server config used to work completely fine, but now when I try to mount it authenticates but then mount_smbfs fails with a broken pipe
any way for me to figure out what the heck is going on?
make sure you have smbfs installed before you try the cifs command
it worked before so I am sure I have it installed
it is definitely installed, newest version
it's something along those lines, let me look at my mount script, I got tired of typing it
sudo mount -t cifs -o user="MSHOME/user%pass" //192.168.1.100/bobo /media/bobo
are you doing that mount command from ubuntu?
yea
I am trying to mount from OS X does that matter?
is it an ubuntu share you're trying to mount?
yes
cbrunner$ sudo mount -t cifs -o user="ccb%mypass" smb://myip/music /Volumes/music
every time I do that it says no file or directory /Volumes/music
so you're running a samba share from an ubuntu box and you're trying to mount it in osx?
yep
did you already try this guide? http://docs.huihoo.com/darwin/opendarwin/articles/osx_smb/ar01s02.html
yea man, this share has worked flawlessly for months and all the sudden out the blue it started doing this, I didnt even update anything
sudo /etc/init.d/samba restart on the ubuntu box
I have restarted the box and restarted samba many times, didnt work
hmmm
what is the error again?
